locations.name: CN Tower
locations.address: 301 Front St W, Toronto, ON M5V 2T6
locations.description: One of the world’s tallest freestanding structures, the CN Tower offers stunning panoramic views of Toronto.

locations.name: Royal Ontario Museum (ROM)
locations.description: Canada’s largest museum of world cultures and natural history, featuring dinosaur fossils, Egyptian artifacts, and Indigenous art.

locations.name: Ontario Science Centre
locations.address: 770 Don Mills Rd, Toronto, ON M3C 1T3
locations.description: An interactive museum that brings science to life with hands-on exhibits, a planetarium, and immersive experiences for all ages.

locations.name: Casa Loma
locations.description: A majestic Gothic-style castle with secret tunnels, grand halls, and lush gardens.

locations.name: Toronto Zoo
locations.description: One of the largest zoos in the world, featuring diverse habitats, over 5,000 animals, and conservation programs.

locations.name: Ripley's Aquarium of Canada
locations.description: A spectacular underwater attraction featuring thousands of marine animals, a moving walkway through a shark tunnel, and interactive touch pools.

locations.name: Canada's Wonderland
locations.address: 1 Canada's Wonderland Dr, Vaughan, ON L6A 1S6
locations.description: A thrilling amusement park featuring over 200 attractions, including roller coasters, a massive water park, and family-friendly rides.

locations.name: Art Gallery of Ontario (AGO)
locations.address: 317 Dundas St W, Toronto, ON M5T 1G4
locations.description: Home to a vast collection of over 95,000 artworks, including pieces by the Group of Seven, European masters, and contemporary artists.
